title: Bigot

fields.name: Abilities:
fields.value:
- Each night, choose 3 players to Hunt. If any of them are in the Hated subalignment, you'll be given 1 bullet for each one. You won't be told who is in the Hated subalignment.
- During the day, you can instead choose players equal to the number of bullets you have. The next night, instead of Hunting, you'll shoot the chosen players.

fields.name: Attributes:
fields.value:
- At the start of the game, you will be assigned a random subalignment from the good faction in this game as the Hated subalignment (ie: Town killing). There must be 2 or more players in this subalignment.
- If it's no longer possible to fulfill your Destiny (like there are no longer enough players in the Hated Subalignment for you to kill), the Hated Subalignment is randomized again and you must kill 2 players from there.

fields.name: Destiny:
fields.value: Kill 2 players from the Hated subalignment.

fields.name: Goal:
fields.value: Have each living Peasant fulfill their Destiny.

desc:
Post 4436
*Many rumors circulated about the farmhand on the lakeside estate. Some rumors warned of his hatred for merchants - they reminded him too much of his master. Other rumors said he'd kill anyone who carried a gun, having a fit from his past as a veteran. There was no rhyme or reason to why he'd threaten to kill someone, but folktales kept trying to find a pattern.*
